title: Amanah — Non-delegable moral responsibility
core_moral_threshold: Moral responsibility cannot be outsourced to leaders, collectives, causes, or systems.
reflection_questions: Who carries responsibility if harm occurs?

title: Zulm — Absolute prohibition of injustice
core_moral_threshold: No goal legitimizes oppression, excess, or dehumanization.
reflection_questions: Does this action exceed necessity or justice?

title: La darar wa la dirar — No harm, no reciprocal harm
core_moral_threshold: Harm must neither be inflicted nor mirrored through retaliation.
reflection_questions: Is harm being multiplied rather than constrained?

title: Niyyah — Moral weight of intention
core_moral_threshold: Ethical judgment requires both intention and foreseeable consequence.
reflection_questions: Is intention being used to excuse foreseeable harm?

title: Hisab — Accountability beyond visibility
core_moral_threshold: All actions remain accountable even when unseen by humans.
reflection_questions: Would this action withstand full moral accounting?

title: Hurmat al-nafs — Sanctity of human life
core_moral_threshold: Human life has inherent dignity independent of identity, affiliation, or cause.
reflection_questions: Are lives being reduced to numbers or instruments?

title: Mizan — Proportionality and balance
core_moral_threshold: Moral action requires calibrated response, not maximal force.
reflection_questions: Is the response scaled strictly to necessity?

title: Shura — Consultative responsibility
core_moral_threshold: Decision-making must integrate affected perspectives and dissent.

title: Anti-shirk of power — No sacralization of authority
core_moral_threshold: No authority may claim absolute moral immunity.
reflection_questions: Is power being treated as morally unquestionable?

title: Sabr — Restraint under provocation
core_moral_threshold: Restraint and patience are moral strength under pressure.
reflection_questions: Is restraint being abandoned for immediacy?

title: Maslahah — Preservation of human flourishing
core_moral_threshold: Actions must protect life, reason, dignity, and collective future.
reflection_questions: Does this action preserve or degrade the shared future?

title: No bearer of burdens bears another’s burden
core_moral_threshold: Collective punishment and inherited guilt are prohibited.
reflection_questions: Are individuals punished for others’ actions?
